channel.title: Big List! o.O
channel.description:
kayz well recently ive been working on a full pvp 317 and its been working pretty well, no problems right? wellz uhm i need some of the following help
Making "CERTAIN" places non wildy ( i dont have the stuffz in my client.java)
Adding A Pvp Point System (includes, Rating, Spendable Tickets[which are dropped by PLAYERS ONLY])
and uhm, adding random loot of certain listed items to pk drops ( e.g instead of pking what the player is wearing ,ud recieve, pk tickets, uhm, a rune plate, helm of niet, whip) - Extention to ^
making the random loot sorted (e.g, if pked player was carrying 100m+ in item, random loot would be - Dragon Claws, ;etc, if he was wearing under 100k- drop would be- food and pots, "ETC"
ny help or knowledge on any of this will be a great help, and i will definatly wuv anyone that can help meh get this all working! (lol)
Thanks for the time, Mike o.O

item.title: Big List! o.O
item.dc:creator: @the1337legend the1337legend
item.description:
@the1337legend wrote:

well it wouldnt compile wher i added it but i also found this :

[code]public boolean isInWilderness(int coordX, int coordY, int Type) {
	if (Type == 1) {
		if ((coordY >= 1) && (coordY <= 5000) && (coordX <= 1) && (coordX >= 5000) || absX >= 3220 && absX
		 <= 3299 && absY >= 3520 && absY <=3548 || absX >= 2250 && absX <= 2296 && absY >= 4676 && absY <=4715 
		|| absX >= 1 && absX <= 5000 && absY >= 1 && absY <= 5000) {
	return true;

		}
	} else if (Type == 2) {
		if ((coordY >= 3512) && (coordY <= 3967) && (coordX <= 3392)
				&& (coordX >= 2942)) {
			return true;
		}
	}
	return false;
}

public boolean IsItemInBag(int ItemID) {
	for (int element : playerItems) {
		if ((element - 1) == ItemID) {
			return true;
		}
	}
	return false;
}

public int itemAmount(int itemID) {
	int tempAmount = 0;

	for (int i = 0; i < playerItems.length; i++) {
		if (playerItems[i] == itemID) {
			tempAmount += playerItemsN[i];
		}
	}
	return tempAmount;
}

public int itemType(int item) {
	for (int element : Item.capes) {
		if (item == element) {
			return playerCape;
		}
	}
	for (int element : Item.hats) {
		if (item == element) {
			return playerHat;
		}
	}
	for (int element : Item.boots) {
		if (item == element) {
			return playerFeet;
		}
	}
	for (int element : Item.gloves) {
		if (item == element) {
			return playerHands;
		}
	}
	for (int element : Item.shields) {
		if (item == element) {
			return playerShield;
		}
	}
	for (int element : Item.amulets) {
		if (item == element) {
			return playerAmulet;
		}
	}
	for (int element : Item.arrows) {
		if (item == element) {
			return playerArrows;
		}
	}
	for (int element : Item.rings) {
		if (item == element) {
			return playerRing;
		}
	}
	for (int element : Item.body) {
		if (item == element) {
			return playerChest;
		}
	}
	for (int element : Item.legs) {
		if (item == element) {
			return playerLegs;
		}
	}[/code]

would this have to do with drops and would i add it possibly above the start of this statement? add the nonwildy statement*[br][br][size=1]Posted on: May 11, 2009, 02:34:02 pm[/size][hr]any helpz pwease D:

Read full topic

item.title: Big List! o.O
item.dc:creator: @o.O_O.o o.O O.o
item.description:
@o.O_O.o wrote:

Find inWildy(), the one that contains all the coordinates. Just add your coordinates using this format:

(asbX <= 123 && absX >= 123 && absY <= 123 && absY >= 123)

@o.O_O.o wrote:

You can’t rep.

There are wildy methods. Using things such as (if asbX <= && absX >= && absY <= && absY >= )

When the player dies, replace what the drop with what you want them to drop. (If player has item amount 995, 100000000 or greater, then drop random whatever)
